glosses: wholeheartedly, with heart and soul or body and soul

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish جان باش ایله (can baş ile), from جان (cān, can) and باش (baş), equivalent to can (“life, soul, heart”) + -la (instrumental suffix) + baş (“head”) + -la, literally “with soul/life and head”, or can + ile + baş + ile.
